topic: Deep dive: collections standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: collections standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: Collections Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an in-depth look at the collections standard library module in Python 3.12+, highlighting its key features and enhancements.
key_points: Introduction of Counter class for counting elements in iterables
New functions in the abc (Abstract Base Classes) module for collections

code_examples.code:
from collections.abc import Callable

deque_obj = deque([1, 2, 3])
deque_obj.extendleft([4, 5])
print(list(deque_obj))

from collections import Counter
counter = Counter(['apple', 'banana', 'apple', 'orange', 'banana'])
print(counter.most_common(2))

version_notes: Python 3.12+ introduces several enhancements to the collections standard library module.
The new functions in the abc module provide a way to define and use abstract base classes for collections.
caveats: Not all enhancements apply to every collection type.
Some of the new features are only available when using Python 3.12+ or later versions.
